description:
Premier League football news now. Liverpool have agreed to sign Danny Ings, once his contract finishes at Burnley at the end of the month. He still needs to complete a medical before that switch is finalised. Sports News reporter David Ornstein has more.

Liverpool have been in talks with Danny Ings for several weeks now. He scored 21 goals in helping Burnley to the Premier League and then 11 in 35 league games last season. He's out of contract at the end of June, but his age 22 means Liverpool will have to pay Burnley compensation. Although they've rejected Liverpool's initial offer, it's likely an agreement will be reached to save this being decided by a tribunal.

Well, West Ham United's search for a new manager looks to be entering its final stages, with the club hoping to make an announcement within the next 48 hours. The board met with candidates over the weekend. Talks are at an advanced stage, and Slaven Bilic is the favourite to take over from Sam Allardyce.
